details.environment: Arctic, Desert, Forest, Hill, Swamp, Urban

languages.custom: the languages it knew in life

description.value: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Sir Godfrey Gwilym makes two fist attacks or two attacks with his longsword.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature against which Sir Godfrey Gwilym has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra [[/damage 4d6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage. Instead of dealing damage, Sir Godfrey Gwilym can grapple the target (escape DC 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature against which Sir Godfrey Gwilym has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra [[/damage 4d6 type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Sir Godfrey Gwilym targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a [[/save wis 15 format=long]]. On a failure, the target is &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} until he deals damage to it, or until the end of his next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of Sir Godfrey Gwilym for 1 minute. The &Reference[frightened]{frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see Sir Godfrey Gwilym, ending the &Reference[frightened]{frightened} condition on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Regeneration. Sir Godfrey Gwilym regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of its turn. If he takes &Reference[fire]{fire} or &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of his next turn. His body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Rejuvenation. When Sir Godfrey Gwilym is destroyed, his soul lingers. After 24 hours, His soul inhabits and animates another &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While his soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to &Reference[force]{force} the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Turn Immunity. Sir Godfrey Gwilym is immune to effects that turn &Reference[undead]{undead}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Vengeful Tracker. Sir Godfrey Gwilym knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and Sir Godfrey Gwilym are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by Sir Godfrey Gwilym dies, he knows.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Spellcasting. Sir Godfrey is a 16th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (spell save DC 14). Sir Godfrey has the following paladin spells prepared:

1st level (4 slots): command, divine favor, thunderous smite

2nd level (3 slots): branding smite, magic weapon

3rd level (3 slots): blinding smite, dispel magic

4th level (2 slots): staggering smite

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is &Reference[undead]{undead}, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls &Reference[prone]{prone} and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

macro.name: Command

description.value: Your prayer empowers you with divine radiance. Until the spell ends, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d4 &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage on a hit.

The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike. The attack deals an extra 2d6 &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage to the target, which becomes visible if it is &Reference[invisible]{invisible}, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can’t become &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. 

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

system.chatFlavor: [2d6 - radiant] The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends

description.value:
You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, that weapon becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

system.chatFlavor: [bludgeoning] Weapon Damage Type - bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, [piercing] Weapon Damage Type - bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, [slashing] Weapon Damage Type - bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing

macro.name: Magic Weapon

description.value:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.
